title: Berry Nut Muffins
directions: Preheat oven to 400Â° and coat a muffin pan with Pam spray.
Sift the flour, salt, baking powder in a large bowl then add honey. Continue to stir until combined.
In another bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and oil.
Make a well in the center of the flour mixture and pour egg mixture. Whisk all ingredients together.
Fold in the berries and nuts. The batter will be a little lumpy so do NOT over stir!
Fill the muffin pan 2/3 of the way from the top.
Bake for 12-14 minutes if making 12 small ones or 15-17 minutes if making 6 large ones. Use a knife a stick it in muffin to test if done. If knife comes out clean, then they are ready.
Let cool for several minutes before transferring to another plate.
ingredients: 1 cup almond milk or soy milk, room temperature
1/2 cup, chopped dried cranberries and/or blueberries (or both)
1/2 cup finely chopped walnuts or pecans
